duties_responsibilities.duty: Design, implement, maintain, and evolve security solutions in a fast-paced high-growth startup environment.
Ensure the security and integrity of systems against an ever-evolving and changing security landscape.
Identify the short and long-term security needs of the organization to develop the company’s information security strategy.
Collaborate with teams to develop, implement, and govern security processes and best practices.
Participate in incident responses, containing, investigating, and preventing future information security incidents.
Analyze business projects and roadmaps, identifying security dependencies and risks, and assist in designing solutions to remediate those risks.
Stay informed about current and emerging security threats, providing insights on designing security capabilities to mitigate risks.
Test and audit information security controls in enterprise, cloud, and product environments.
Lead or participate in projects relating to risk management, compliance, business policies, vulnerability management, security Project Management, and Knowledge Management.
Collaborate in providing responses to customer security questionnaires and internal/external auditors regarding technology.
Work with product teams, leaders, and specialists to implement and drive a security strategic plan and vision for the business and products.
Collaborate with the sourcing and execution of external penetration tests and drive the remediation process of findings.
Solution frameworks and strategies that grow with the needs of the business, products, and customers/users, further strengthening and maturing the security posture.
Lead efforts to help keep the team secure with internal audits, learning sessions, and leading informative sessions with various teams.
Automate security tooling and plan for growth and expansion.

education_certification.credential: Staff level experience in cybersecurity or related fields. CISM, CCSK, and CISSP certifications are a plus but not required. Bachelor's degree in Cybersecurity, Computer Science, or a related field (Master's preferred)
